intro: Cerastium rubescens var. koreanum, commonly known as the Korean mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Korea. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant features dense clusters of tiny white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically rounded and hairy, forming a mat-like growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments.
